about_the_game:
Dash, dodge, and take aim! A fresh take on arena shooters, where it only takes one shot to kill or be killed. 1 Shot 1 Kill is a deadly third person arena combat shooter.

In the far reaches of space on the abandon mining planet Hyperion VI, the tyrant Adrik holds a combat tournament for his own entertainment and glory. In this sci-fi future, throwing knives have homing and light sabers are insanely fast, making them the preferred weapons for close quarter fighting.

Core Features

  • 1 Shot 1 Kill: One shot kills are the most satisfying
  • Limited Ranged Ammo: You'll need to retrieve your thrown knives to reload. All shots have a significant amount of homing
  • Unlimited Melee: Instant melee with a generous range and cool down
  • Melee Reflect: You can reflect shots with your melee attack, light saber style


  • Dash and Wall Jump: Every point on a map should be reachable via dashing or wall-jumps
  • Dash Grab: You can grab shots out of the air while dashing
  • Maximum Information: We tried to maximize player information and minimize hidden information. You can run, but you can't hide
  • Three Game Modes: The Quest for Hyperion, The Battle Arena, and The Trials of Time

The Quest for Hyperion

  • Survive waves of enemies solo or with friends
  • Battle over 12 stages of progressive danger, each with it's own unique boss fight
  • Split Screen Local Mode: Reviving the golden era of couch multiplayer
  • Epic Battlefields from the city of Catchfools to the Battleship Revenant
  • Warning! Friendly fire is always enabled

The Battle Arena

  • Play against your friends over a series of quick matches to determine the winner, often with a nail-biting ending
  • Dynamic Game Balancing: Keeps competition fierce by buffing the underdogs of a tournament
  • Diverse power-ups and weapon types ensure no two matches are alike
  • A variety of power-ups and weapon types ensure that no two matches are ever the same
  • Best played with friends, on a couch, together in real life

The Trials of Time

  • Hone your deadly reflexes in these challenging time trial scenarios
  • Master advanced techniques like rocket jumps
  • Push your skills to the limit
  • Can you get 5 kills in under 2 seconds?

Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 12.04+, SteamOS+
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 M380
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 3.0+ (2.1 with ARB extensions acceptable)
  • Storage: 4 GB available space
